intro: Alphonsea tsangyanensis, commonly known as the Chinese alphonsea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Alphonsea tsangyanensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
